body.description: GIGABYTE gaming monitors pack upscale performance into a streamlined package. The G24F 2 provides an advanced gaming experience through AORUS utility software and offers fluid, vibrant gameplay with 1ms response time, up to 165Hz refresh rate, SS IPS panel display, and compatibility with graphic card software.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Us GIGABYTE offers a comprehensive product lineup that aims to “Upgrade Your Life.” With expertise encompassing consumer, business, gaming, and cloud systems, GIGABYTE established its reputation as a leader in the industry with award-winning products including motherboards, graphics cards, laptops, mini PCs, monitors, and other PC components and accessories.As a perennial developer in PC and server hardware and solutions, GIGABYTE is dedicated to foster marvelous user experiences for content creators and gamers, allowing their imagination to manifest a better life; as a server hardware and solution provider, GIGABYTE is poised to extend our scope in business servers and cloud systems with hardware and software solutions that integrate AI and AloT applications to allow customers to capture, analyze, and transform digital information into economic data, accelerating businesses' success from edge to cloud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Picture Quality
reviews.reviewText: Nothing to dislike about this. Easy to operate and the the picture quality is great. Picture frame speed works fine for me. No lag time. Use mine for gaming on WOWS. Crisp and clear.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Secret Monster Monitor
reviews.reviewText: I'm not going to go in-depth as there are already 'professional' reviews out there that one can go and read if they want full coverage. Some info:Screen / Display quality: It's great, I got no dead pixels as far as I can tell and the backlight bleed for me isn't bad at all. The picture quality for this price range is probably among the best if not the best out of the box. I don't think I've had to tweak any of the display settings other than brightness because of how good it looks as is. It's plenty bright to use on sunny days by the way, and this coming from a Californian.Gaming: Of course it won't compete with good 200hz+ and 300+ hz monitors but it doesn't need to. For being able to find this monitor as cheap as $130 when it goes on sale, it blows everything out of the water that it's supposed to compete with. Do not use Aim Stabilizer or Super Resolution and set OD to either Smart OD or Picture Quality for the best anti-ghosting, Balance will start to introduce notable ghosting but it's nothing terrible.Features: I haven't used the OSD sidekick software because I figured out which settings I wanted to use early on and the hardware controller was more than good enough to use for that. It has everything you *need* in a gaming monitor (and more than most in this price range too). All the ports are easily accessible and I didn't know this at first but the stand has an opening that is supposed to help with cable management.Build Quality: I suppose this is more for the stand than the display but it's good. It doesn't wobble and doesn't feel particularly cheap. It's nice that it's height adjustable and it tilts, however it cannot be used vertically for anyone that wants it setup that way.So yeah, an unbeatable monitor for $130 and still a great deal for $160.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Missing safety screw
reviews.reviewText: EDIT: - after 1 day, pixels went out. About 1.5 inch wide from top to bottom just went out while using the monitor for work.Oiriginal: Bought it used. Works great and looks amazing, but it's missing the safety screw underneath to secure the base is missing.Other than that everything works great

reviews.reviewText: Esta pantalla cumple con todas las espectativas, la recomiendo, encuentras un menú completo y fácil de manejar, fácil de armar su base, lo recomiendo mucho por su calidad y precio.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very good monitor for the price!
reviews.reviewText: really good monitor for the price! easy to setup and able to be mounted if that’s something you’d want to do. default color settings are a little off though, id recommend changing it. overall very good monitor tho! i didn’t have a problem with dead pixels or anything like that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Review for the G24F 2 1080p, 165hz, IPS, 1ms monitor
reviews.reviewText: First things first, this is an amazing monitor for the prize I bought it for. I've never experienced a refresh rate over 75hz on a monitor, so that was amazing itself and I def can NOT go back to 75hz or god forbid 60hz.EDIT: The monitor has lines all over the screen now. I can’t see anything. Will never buy a Gigabyte monitor again. This thing didn’t even last a year before it failed.The colors are great, brightness is great, overall it's much superior to my Dell SE2717 which is also 1080p IPS but the refresh rate is 75hz, and that I've had since 2018. That (Dell) monitor is now my secondary monitor.Now the one problem that is making me rate this 4 outta 5 stars. I have 1 single stuck pixel. After analyzing the screen up close, I found it, and for me it's in an unfortunate place, almost in the middle of the screen. Once I found it, I could not stop noticing it and thinking about it.Thing is, being from outside mainland U.S., this monitor took almost a month to arrive. I am not gonna return and ask for a replacement just to wait AGAIN for another 3 weeks for a new monitor to arrive. I'm just gonna have to deal with that one stuck pixel *sigh* it's not really that big of a deal but mildly infuriating.After much research, apparently stuck pixels will go away on their own after some time has passed, so I guess I'll just wait it out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Incredible. Turned out to be excellent for gaming and work. Bright colours and amazing refresh rate. I recommend it.

The media could not be loaded. La verdad que aprovecha cada uno de los detalles y la resolución con los fps ni que decir el HDR muy básico pero notable la verdad que vales la pena! En consola ni que decir así como en PC muy bueno en verdad

reviews.reviewTitle: Best 165hz 24 inch gaming monitor on the market
reviews.reviewText: After painstakingly doing research for 2 weeks, I’ve settled on this monitor. I wish I bought this right from the start but because of all the fear-mongering about dead pixels… I hesitated. Zero issues whatsoever. This is the best monitor I’ve owned… the picture, colours, and image quality is the best I’ve seen and I have other $300-$600 monitors. Congrats Gigabyte on packing a punch in this one. You’ve earned a new customer moving forward.
Works perfect, no problems. Best gaming monitor at 165hz 24 inches 1ms👍👍
No compres otro que no sea este, el mejor Monitor Calidad - Precio

reviews.reviewTitle: great monitor at a great price
reviews.reviewText: This is a great refurbished product. Shows no signs of wear or tear, and is such an upgrade over my "office" monitor. Gigabyte makes a great "gaming" monitor that can certainly do double duty for fun and for work. It works perfectly with my Mac Mini, and my work laptop (windows pc). I love that I can plug my speakers into the monitor and it's one less thing to switch from one setup to the other. Definitely worth a closer look if you are looking for a display upgrade.
